current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require an independent alternative analysis of the
		  consideration of the use of targeted lethal force against a particular, known
		  United States person knowingly engaged in acts of international terrorism
		  against the United States and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Targeted Strike Oversight Reform
			 Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

quote.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 3(7)
			 of the National Security Act of 1947

quote.#tail:
has the
			 meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(4) of the National Security Act of 1947

term.#tail:
means a citizen
			 of the United States or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence (as
			 defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 101(a)(20) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

text.#text:
Upon a determination by the head of an element of the
			 intelligence community that a particular, known United States person is
			 knowingly engaged in acts of international terrorism against the United States,
			 such that the United States Government is considering the legality or the use
			 of targeted lethal force against that United States person, the head of the
			 element shall, as soon as practicable, notify the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 complete an independent alternative analysis (commonly referred to as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: Not later than 15 days after the date the

quote.#tail:
) of the information relied on to support the
			 determination made under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that the individual
			 appointed to lead such alternative analysis does not report to the head of the
			 element of the intelligence community who made the determination under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
In completing the independent alternative analysis
			 required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall notify the Inspector General of the
			 Intelligence Community of the receipt of a notification under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

header.#text:
Notification of
			 the Inspector General of the Intelligence Community

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall notify the
			 congressional intelligence committees, in writing, of the receipt of a
			 notification under

, including the identity of the United States
			 person, and the results of the independent alternative analysis performed under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, including any written product containing the alternative
			 analysis, or if no product has been created, a summary of such analysis.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b

text.#text:
Nothing in this section shall be construed to
			 impede the ability of the United States Government to conduct any operation
			 consistent with otherwise applicable law.

On an annual basis the Inspector General of
			 the Intelligence Community shall—

header.#text:
Inspector
			 General of the Intelligence Community review

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to the element of the intelligence
			 community’s compliance with all appropriate policies and procedures related to
			 consideration of the use of targeted lethal force against a particular, known
			 United States person; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013/s:3/ss:c

text.#text:
conduct a review of any notifications
			 received under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the
			 congressional intelligence committees a report on the findings of such
			 review.

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act or the amendments made
			 by this Act may be construed to authorize the use of targeted lethal force
			 against a United States person.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1035 IS: Targeted Strike Oversight Reform Act of 2013
